qas.question: How long has flower evolution occurred?
Humans have effected some flowers so much they can no longer do what in nature?
What heritage do many modern domesticated flower species have?
Why did weeds grow with human crops?
What feature helped flowers not get plucked?
What has happened to weeds due to human influence?
How long has weed evolution occurred?
What was the origin of many simple weeds?
What have weeds developed a dependence on?
What characteristic caused crops not to be harvested?

context: Flower evolution continues <b6_0>to the <a0_0>present day<b6_0/><a0_0/>; modern flowers have been so profoundly influenced by humans that some of them <b5_0>cannot be <a1_0>pollinated<a1_0/> in nature<b5_0/>. Many modern <b7_0>domesticated flower species<b7_0/> were <a2_0>formerly simple weeds<a2_0/>, which sprouted only when the ground was disturbed. Some of them tended to grow with human crops, perhaps already having <a3_0>symbiotic companion plant relationships<a3_0/> with them, and the <a4_0>prettiest<a4_0/> did not get plucked because of <b9_0>their beauty<b9_0/>, developing a dependence upon and special adaptation to <b8_0>human affection<b8_0/>.
